title: Study identifier
description: Unique identifier for this study

title: General comments
description: Any general comments the coder wants to add about this study

title: Year
description: Year (or years) the data were collected

title: Country
description: Country (or countries) where the data were collected

title: NA
description: NA

title: Methods
description: Description of the methods used by the study

title: Sample size
description: Total number of human participants in the study (note: the actual sample size may be larger if multiple observations are collected per participant)

title: Sample age
description: Age range of the participants in the study

title: Subsample
description: If studies contain several samples, specify them here

title: Name
description: A unique name (in this study), to be able to refer to this subsample later, and to easily find it afterwards

title: Size
description: Sample size of subsample

title: Age
description: Age of subsample

title: Type of study
description: Whether the study was qualitative or quantitative

title: Variables
description: The variables as used/observed in this study (i.e. operationalisations or an aspects)

title: Operationalisations
description: The operationalisations (measurements or manipulations) used in the study

title: Variable Name
description: A unique name (in this study), to be able to refer to this variable later, and to easily find it afterwards

title: Moment
description: Moment(s) this variable was measured/manipulated.

title: Type of operationalisation
description: Whether this variable is a manipulation, a single measurement, or an aggregate

title: Type of data
description: "Measurement level" of this operationalisation.

title: Values
description: Possible values this variable can take: only valid for "nominal" or "ordinal" variables.

title: Labels
description: Labels for the values.

title: Description
description: A description of this variable (can be more extensive than the name)

title: Comment
description: Any relevant comments the coder wants to add

title: Treatments
description: The treatments for each group

title: Treatment
description: Details about the delivered treatment for this group (this operationalisation value)

title: Treatment Variable
description: Name of the treatment variable.

title: Group
description: Which treatment group (operationalisation value of the treatment variable) this description pertains to.

title: Fear hierarchy
description: The exposure trials are rank-ordered in their ability to elicit anxiety.

title: Fear monitoring
description: The fear level of the participant is being monitored throughout the exposure trial.

title: Fear level
description: The end of the exposure trial is determined by fear reduction to a certain level.

title: Expectancy statement
description: Expectancies for aversive events are explicitly stated before the start of the exposure trial.

title: Learning consolidation
description: Following the exposure trial, the learning is consolidated by asking participants to judge what they learned regarding the non-occurrence of the feared event, discrepancies between what was predicted and what occurred.

title: Expectancy violation
description: The end of the exposure trial is determined by expectancy reduction to a certain level.

title: Lessen overestimation
description: Cognitive interventions designed to lessen probability overestimation (e.g., “I am unlikely to be bitten by the dog”) and perceived negative valence (e.g., “It is not so bad to be rejected”) occur.

title: Deepened extinction
description: Combination of multiple cues (internal and/or external) during exposure therapy, after initially conducting some exposure to each cue in isolation.

title: Occasional reinforced extinction
description: Occasional CS-US pairings during extinction training occur.

title: Removal of safety signals
description: The prevention or removal of “safety signals” or “safety behaviors" during the exposure therapy occurs.

title: Variability
description: Exposure is conducted with varying stimuli, for varying durations, at varying levels of intensity, or items from a fear hierarchy are selected out of order, rather than continuing exposure in one situation until fear declines before moving to the next situation.

title: Retrieval cues
description: Retrieval cues (of the CS-no US association) are included during extinction training to be used in other contexts once extinction is over.

title: Multiple contexts
description: Interoceptive, imaginal, and in vivo exposures are conducted in multiple different contexts, such as when alone, in unfamiliar places, or at varying times of day or varying days of the week.

title: Reconsolidation
description: The phobic stimulus is introduced for a brief period about 30 minutes before repeated trials of exposure.

title: Results
description: Results based on the data collected in this study

title: Univariate
description: A single statistic about a single variable.

title: Name of result
description: A unique name (in this study), to easily find / meta-analyse / group this result later

title: Variable
description: The variable this result pertains to.

title: Subsample
description: If applicable, the subsample this result pertains to.

title: Value
description: If applicable, the value this result pertains to. For example, for a categorical variable, three percentages can be specified: one for each possible category (as identified by the corresponding value).

title: Moment
description: If applicable, the measurement moemnt this result pertains to. For example, for a longitudinal study, this can be '2' to specify that this is the value of this variable at the second measurement moment.

title: Minimum value
description: If applicable, the minimum value in the data series of this variable.

title: Maximum value
description: If applicable, the maximum value in the data series of this variable.

title: Median value
description: If applicable, the median of this variable.

title: Mean value
description: If applicable, the mean of this variable.

title: Percentage
description: If applicable, the percentage of observations in this category (for a categorical variable) or scoring TRUE (for a logical variable).

title: Sample size
description: This can be used to specify the sample size, if it is different from the sample size of the entire sample or the relevant subsample.

title: Standard deviation
description: If applicable, the standard deviation of this variable.

title: Qualitative
description: If applicable, the original text as extracted from the source material.

title: Comment
description: Any relevant comments the coder wants to add

title: Association
description: An association between two variables.

title: Name of result
description: A unique name (in this study), to easily find / meta-analyse / group this result later

title: First variable
description: The name of the first variable.

title: Values of first variable
description: Values this variable pertains to (e.g. in post hoc analyses).

title: Measurement moment of first variable
description: To which measurement moment of the first variable this association pertains.

title: Second variable
description: The name of the second variable.

title: Values of second variable
description: Values this variable pertains to (e.g. in post hoc analyses).

title: Measurement moment of second variable
description: To which measurement moment of the second variable this association pertains.

title: Subsample
description: If applicable, the subsample this result pertains to.

title: Sample size
description: This can be used to specify the sample size, if it is different from the sample size of the entire sample or the relevant subsample.

title: Degrees of freedom
description: This can be used to specify the degrees of freedom for this analysis, in case for example a t or an F value is extracted.

title: t value
description: The t value of this association.

title: F value
description: The F value of this association

title: Pearson r
description: The bivariate correlation of this association

title: Chi square
description: The chi squared value of this association

title: Raw table
description: A table with the frequencies

title: Cohen's d
description: The Cohen's d value of this association

title: Eta squared
description: The eta squared value of this association

title: Omega squared
description: The omega squared value of this association

title: Odds Ratio
description: The odds ratio of this association

title: p value
description: The association's p value (only extract if nothing else is available)

title: Covariates
description: Number of covariates (for multivariate analyses).

title: Comment
description: Any relevant comments the coder wants to add

title: Recursing element
description: This is a recursing element, one containing itself even.

title: Child 1
description: First placeholder child for recursing element

title: Child 2
description: Second placeholder child for recursing element

title: Itself
description: The recursing element itself
